byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and RICK GLADSTONE

abstract: Stephen O'Brien, new United Nations under secretary general for humanitarian affairs, calls on wealthier countries of world to increase aid to Middle East and Africa to in effort to give refugees fleeing to Europe alternative to fleeing their homelands.
lead_paragraph: The under secretary general of humanitarian affairs, fresh from visits to embattled nations, urged affluent nations to step up aid as a way to stem the flow of refugees.

headline.main: U.N. Says Aid Increase Would Cut Migration
headline.print_headline: U.N. Says Aid Increase Would Slow Refugee Tide

snippet: The under secretary general of humanitarian affairs, fresh from visits to embattled nations, urged affluent nations to step up aid as a way to stem the flow of refugees.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject
